creator: marcel@schutte.com
text:
The exec task outputs two extra newlines at the end of its output. This occurs 
both for executables that do and that don't produce output themselves, so 
whether or not you get lines with '[exec] Whatever...'.
I have tried with previous ant versions and the problem appeared between 1.5.4 
and 1.6.0.

creator: marcel@schutte.com
text:
Created attachment 10727
zip containing build.xml + called windows script and output under antv1.5.4 and antv1.6.1

creator: jkf@apache.org
text:
Created attachment 10730
Patch to avoid producing empty lines while flushing

This new behaviour could be backtraced to the LogOutputStream, where a flush
takes the effect of producing an empty line if no data is to be flushed.
creator: jkf@apache.org
ddevienne@lgc.com
text:
THANK YOU!!! I've been asking about that ever since I started using 1.6beta. --
DD

creator: jkf@apache.org
text:
I 've checked the other output streams for similar issues at flush, but not
found any (a totally different one exists on the flush of the zip output stream.)

creator: peter.reilly@corvil.com
text:
Thansk, patch applied.
The two extra lines were driving me crazy.
*** Bug 28206 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
